member.name: T:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.ChooserBase`1
member.summary: The base class from which all choosers are derived. This class exposes a common function for showing the choosers and an event for handling the chooser result.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus
member.summary: Allows an application to obtain information about the device on which it is running.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus.DeviceManufacturer
member.summary: Returns the manufacturer of the device, such as Samsung or LGE.
member.remarks: Because this property requires the DeviceIdentity capability it is not available on Windows Phone 7 - use GetValue instead.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus.DeviceName
member.summary: Returns the name of the device and possibly the manufacturer, such as Samsung Taylor or Pacific.
member.remarks: Because this property requires the DeviceIdentity capability it is not available on Windows Phone 7 - use GetValue instead.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus.DeviceUniqueId
member.summary: Returns a unique hash for the device, constant across all applications and across flashing / upgrading the OS.
member.remarks: Because this property requires the DeviceIdentity capability it is not available on Windows Phone 7 - use GetValue instead.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus.DeviceTotalMemory
member.summary: Returns the device physical RAM size in bytes.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus.ApplicationCurrentMemoryUsage
member.summary: Returns the current applicationâ€™s memory usage in bytes.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus.ApplicationPeakMemoryUsage
member.summary: Returns the current application peak memory usage in bytes.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Info.DeviceStatus.IsKeyboardPresent
member.summary: Indicates whether the device contains a physical hardware keyboard.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Environment
member.summary: Gives applications access to information about the environment in which they are running.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Environment.DeviceType
member.summary: Gets the type of device on which the application is running. Use this property to determine if your application is running on an actual device or on the device emulator.

member.summary: Shows the Contacts application.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.EmailComposeTask
member.summary: Allows an application to launch the email application with a new message displayed. Use this to allow users to send email from your application.

item.description: Pocket PC 2003 and later, Windows Mobile Version 5.0 and later

member.name: M:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.EmailComposeTask.Show
member.summary: Shows the email application with a new message displayed.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.EmailComposeTask.Body
member.summary: The body of the new email message.
member.remarks: The Body property does not support HTML formatting. If the content assigned to the Body property happens to work with the codepage that maps to the current locale settings for the device, it will be sent using that codepage. If the codepage mapped to the current locale setting cannot render the content, UTF-8 encoding will be used.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.EmailComposeTask.To
member.summary: The recipients on the To line of the new email message.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.EmailComposeTask.Cc
member.summary: The recipients on the cc line of the new email message.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.EmailComposeTask.Bcc
member.summary: Gets or sets the recipients on the Bcc line of the new email message.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Phone.Tasks.EmailComposeTask.Subject
member.summary: The subject of the new email message.

member.summary: Indicates if the device is currently running on battery power or is plugged in to an external power supply.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Phone.Info.PowerSource.Battery
member.summary: The device is running on battery power.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Phone.Info.PowerSource.External
member.summary: The device is plugged in to an external power source, such as being docked to a computer or connected to a power supply.
